page.title: 04Law and order in Aboyne
page.content: {Law and Order:} Aboyne village has one police station which is manned by two policemen. The station is equiped with one cell. The policemen have the use of one car. As well as policing Aboyne they also work with other{local police}in serving a forty mile area outside the village. Their{policework}covers a variety of activities, ranging from giving talks to local school children to working with the local landowners and nature wardens to stop the egg collectors from taking eggs from nests. The{ {crime_rate}is low with speeding offences being the most common, followed by petty thefts. All offences are reported by the Aboyne policemen to the Procurator Fiscal in Aberdeen who then decides whether or not to charge the people involved.
